alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 26 at 2:00AM MST until February 26 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IS NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY STRONG WINDS... .A vigorous storm system and associated cold front will sweep from west to east over northern and central New Mexico today. Very strong to damaging downslope winds over portions of eastern New Mexico will be supportive of fine fuels carrying fire. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 7 PM MST this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (zone 104), East Central Plains (zone 126), Northeast Highlands (zone 123) and Central Highlands (zone 125) from 11 AM this morning until 7 PM MST this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 35 to 45 mph with gusts to 60 to 70 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Around 20 to 25 percent although very strong downslope winds may result in lower humidities. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains
